   13: %% distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
   14: %% WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
   15: %% See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
   16: %% limitations under the License.
   17: %%

   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of traffic between two Diameter nodes, the client being
   23: %% spread across three Erlang nodes.
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(diameter_distribution_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   29: -export([run/0]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([suite/0,
   33:          all/0,
   34:          traffic/1]).
   35: 
   36: %% rpc calls
   37: -export([ping/1,
   38:          start/1,
   39:          connect/1,
   40:          call/1]).
   41: 
   42: %% diameter callbacks
   43: -export([peer_up/3,
   44:          peer_down/3,
   45:          pick_peer/5,
   46:          prepare_request/4,
   47:          prepare_retransmit/4,
   48:          handle_answer/5,
   49:          handle_error/5,
   50:          handle_request/3]).
   51: 
   52: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   53: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc6733.hrl").
   54: 
   55: %% ===========================================================================
   56: 
   57: -define(util, diameter_util).
   58: 
   59: -define(CLIENT, 'CLIENT').
   60: -define(SERVER, 'SERVER').
   61: -define(REALM, "erlang.org").
   62: -define(DICT, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733).
   63: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   64: 
   65: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
   66: -define(SERVICE(Host),
   67:         [{'Origin-Host', Host ++ [$.|?REALM]},
   68:          {'Origin-Realm', ?REALM},
   69:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
   70:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
   71:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
   72:          {'Auth-Application-Id', [?DICT:id()]},
   73:          {'Origin-State-Id', origin()},
   74:          {share_peers, peers()},
   75:          {use_shared_peers, peers()},
   76:          {restrict_connections, false},
   77:          {spawn_opt, {diameter_dist, spawn_local, []}},
   78:          {sequence, fun sequence/0},
   79:          {application, [{dictionary, ?DICT},
   80:                         {module, ?MODULE},
   81:                         {request_errors, callback},
   82:                         {answer_errors, callback}]}]).
   83: 
   84: -define(SUCCESS, 2001).
   85: -define(BUSY,    3004).
   86: -define(LOGOUT,  ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
   87: -define(MOVED,   ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_USER_MOVED').
   88: -define(TIMEOUT, ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_SESSION_TIMEOUT').
   89: 
   90: -define(L, atom_to_list).
   91: -define(A, list_to_atom).
   92: 
   93: %% The order here is significant and causes the server to listen
   94: %% before the clients connect.
   95: -define(NODES, [{server, ?SERVER},
   96:                 {client0, ?CLIENT},
   97:                 {client1, ?CLIENT},
   98:                 {client2, ?CLIENT}]).
   99: 
  100: %% ===========================================================================
  101: 
  102: suite() ->
  103:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 90}}].
  104: 
  105: all() ->
  106:     [traffic].
  107: 
  108: traffic(_Config) ->
  109:     traffic().
  110: 
  111: %% ===========================================================================
  112: 
  113: run() ->
  114:     [] = ?util:run([{fun traffic/0, 60000}]).
  115:     %% process for linked peers to die with
  116: 
  117: %% traffic/0
  118: 
  119: traffic() ->
  120:     true = is_alive(),  %% need distribution for peer nodes
  121:     Nodes = enslave(),
  122:     [] = ping(Nodes),  %% drop client node
  123:     [] = start(Nodes),
  124:     [_] = connect(Nodes),
  125:     [] = send(Nodes).
  126: 
  127: %% enslave/0
  128: %%
  129: %% Start four slave nodes, one to implement a Diameter server,
  130: %% three to implement a client.
  131: 
  132: enslave() ->
  133:     Here = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  134:     Ebin = filename:join([Here, "..", "ebin"]),
  135:     Args = ["-pa", Here, Ebin],
  136:     [{N,S} || {M,S} <- ?NODES, N <- [start(M, Args)]].
  137: 
  138: start(Name, Args) ->
  139:     {ok, _, Node} = ?util:peer(#{name => Name, args => Args}),
  140:     Node.
  141: 
  142: %% ping/1
  143: %%
  144: %% Ensure the client nodes are connected since the sharing of
  145: %% transports is only between connected nodes.
  146: 
  147: ping({?SERVER, _Nodes}) ->
  148:     [];
  149: 
  150: ping({?CLIENT, Nodes}) ->
  151:     [N || {N,_} <- Nodes,
  152:           node() /= N,
  153:           pang <- [net_adm:ping(N)]];
  154: 
  155: ping(Nodes) ->
  156:     [{N,RC} || {N,S} <- Nodes,
  157:                RC <- [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, ping, [{S, Nodes}])],
  158:                RC /= []].
  159: 
  160: %% start/1
  161: %%
  162: %% Start diameter services.
  163: 
  164: start(SvcName)
  165:   when is_atom(SvcName) ->
  166:     ok = diameter:start(),
  167:     ok = diameter:start_service(SvcName, ?SERVICE((?L(SvcName))));
  168: 
  169: start(Nodes) ->
  170:     [{N,RC} || {N,S} <- Nodes,
  171:                RC <- [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start, [S])],
  172:                RC /= ok].
  173: 
  174: sequence() ->
  175:     sequence(sname()).
  176: 
  177: sequence(server) ->
  178:     {0,32};
  179: sequence(Client) ->
  180:     "client" ++ N = ?L(Client),
  181:     {list_to_integer(N), 30}.
  182: 
  183: origin() ->
  184:     origin(sname()).
  185: 
  186: origin(server) ->
  187:     99;
  188: origin(Client) ->
  189:     "client" ++ N = ?L(Client),
  190:     list_to_integer(N).
  191: 
  192: peers() ->
  193:     peers(sname()).
  194: 
  195: peers(server)  -> true;
  196: peers(client0) -> [node() | nodes()];
  197: peers(client1) -> fun erlang:nodes/0;
  198: peers(client2) -> nodes().
  199: 
  200: %% connect/1
  201: %%
  202: %% Establish one connection to the server from each of the client
  203: %% nodes.
  204: 
  205: connect({?SERVER, _, []}) ->
  206:     [_LRef = ?util:listen(?SERVER, tcp)];
  207: 
  208: connect({?CLIENT, [{Node, _} | _], [LRef] = Acc}) ->
  209:     ?util:connect(?CLIENT, tcp, {Node, LRef}),
  210:     Acc;
  211: 
  212: connect(Nodes) ->
  213:     lists:foldl(fun({N,S}, A) ->
  214:                         rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, connect, [{S, Nodes, A}])
  215:                 end,
  216:                 [],
  217:                 Nodes).
  218: 
  219: %% ===========================================================================
  220: 
  221: %% send/1
  222: 
  223: send(Nodes) ->
  224:     ?util:run([[fun send/2, Nodes, T]
  225:                || T <- [local, remote, timeout, failover]]).
  226: 
  227: %% send/2
  228: 
  229: %% Send a request from the first client node, using a the local
  230: %% transport.
  231: send(Nodes, local) ->
  232:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS}
  233:         = send(Nodes, 0, str(?LOGOUT));
  234: 
  235: %% Send a request from the first client node, using a transport on the
  236: %% another node.
  237: send(Nodes, remote) ->
  238:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS}
  239:         = send(Nodes, 1, str(?LOGOUT));
  240: 
  241: %% Send a request that the server discards.
  242: send(Nodes, timeout) ->
  243:     {error, timeout} = send(Nodes, 1, str(?TIMEOUT));
  244: 
  245: %% Send a request that causes the server to take the transport down.
  246: send(Nodes, failover) ->
  247:     #'diameter_base_answer-message'{'Result-Code' = ?BUSY}
  248:         = send(Nodes, 2, str(?MOVED)).
  249: 
  250: %% ===========================================================================
  251: 
  252: str(Cause) ->
  253:     #diameter_base_STR{'Destination-Realm'   = ?REALM,
  254:                        'Auth-Application-Id' = ?DICT:id(),
  255:                        'Termination-Cause'   = Cause}.
  256: 
  257: %% send/3
  258: 
  259: send([_, {Node, _} | _], Where, Req) ->
  260:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, call, [{Where, Req}]).
  261: 
  262: %% call/1
  263: 
  264: call({Where, Req}) ->
  265:     diameter:call(?CLIENT, ?DICT, Req, [{extra, [{Where, sname()}]}]).
  266: 
  267: %% sname/0
  268: 
  269: sname() ->
  270:     ?A(hd(string:tokens(?L(node()), "@"))).
  271: 
  272: %% ===========================================================================
  273: %% diameter callbacks
  274: 
  275: %% peer_up/3
  276: 
  277: peer_up(_SvcName, _Peer, State) ->
  278:     State.
  279: 
  280: %% peer_down/3
  281: 
  282: peer_down(_SvcName, _Peer, State) ->
  283:     State.
  284: 
  285: %% pick_peer/4
  286: 
  287: pick_peer([LP], _, ?CLIENT, _State, {0, client0}) ->
  288:     {ok, LP};
  289: 
  290: pick_peer(_, Peers, ?CLIENT, _State, {1, client0}) ->
  291:     [RP] = [T || {_, #diameter_caps{origin_state_id = {[1],_}}} = T <- Peers],
  292:     {ok, RP};
  293: 
  294: %% Sending on the remote transport causes the server to take the
  295: %% transport down. Retransmission on the local.
  296: pick_peer(LP, RP, ?CLIENT, _State, {2, client0}) ->
  297:     {ok, case [T || {_, #diameter_caps{origin_state_id = {[2],_}}} = T <- RP] of
  298:              [T] ->
  299:                  T;
  300:              _ ->
  301:                  hd([_] = LP)
  302:          end}.
  303: 
  304: %% prepare_request/4
  305: 
  306: prepare_request(Pkt, ?CLIENT, {_Ref, Caps}, {_, client0}) ->
  307:     #diameter_packet{msg = Req}
  308:         = Pkt,
  309:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  310:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  311:         = Caps,
  312:     {send, Req#diameter_base_STR{'Origin-Host' = OH,
  313:                                  'Origin-Realm' = OR,
  314:                                  'Session-Id' = diameter:session_id(OH)}}.
  315: 
  316: %% prepare_retransmit/4
  317: 
  318: prepare_retransmit(Pkt, ?CLIENT, _, {_, client0}) ->
  319:     #diameter_packet{msg = #diameter_base_STR{'Termination-Cause' = ?MOVED}}
  320:         = Pkt,  %% assert
  321:     {send, Pkt}.
  322: 
  323: %% handle_answer/5
  324: 
  325: handle_answer(Pkt, _Req, ?CLIENT, _Peer, {_, client0}) ->
  326:     #diameter_packet{msg = Rec, errors = []} = Pkt,
  327:     Rec.
  328: 
  329: %% handle_error/5
  330: 
  331: handle_error(Reason, _Req, ?CLIENT, _Peer, {_, client0}) ->
  332:     {error, Reason}.
  333: 
  334: %% handle_request/3
  335: 
  336: handle_request(Pkt, ?SERVER, Peer) ->
  337:     server = sname(),  %% assert
  338:     #diameter_packet{msg = Req}
  339:         = Pkt,
  340:     request(Req, Peer).
  341: 
  342: request(#diameter_base_STR{'Termination-Cause' = ?TIMEOUT}, _) ->
  343:     discard;
  344: 
  345: request(#diameter_base_STR{'Termination-Cause' = ?MOVED}, Peer) ->
  346:     {TPid, #diameter_caps{origin_state_id = {_, [N]}}} = Peer,
  347:     fail(N, TPid);
  348: 
  349: request(#diameter_base_STR{'Session-Id' = SId}, {_, Caps}) ->
  350:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  351:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  352:         = Caps,
  353:     {reply, #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  354:                                'Session-Id' = SId,
  355:                                'Origin-Host' = OH,
  356:                                'Origin-Realm' = OR}}.
  357: 
  358: fail(0, _) ->     %% sent from the originating node ...
  359:     {protocol_error, ?BUSY};
  360: 
  361: fail(_, TPid) ->  %% ... or through a remote node: force failover
  362:     exit(TPid, kill),
  363:     discard.
